treatment.reference: Transfer of Halobacterium saccharovorum, Halobacterium sodomense, Halobacterium trapanicum NRC 34021 and Halobacterium lacusprofundi to the Genus Halorubrum gen. nov., as Halorubrum saccharovorum comb. nov., Halorubrum sodomense comb. nov., Halorubrum trapanicum comb. nov., and Halorubrum lacusprofundi comb. nov. Syst Appl Microbiol 18:237-243
treatment.description: Rod-shaped cells (0.6-1.2 µm wide x 2.5 µm long). Motile. Gas vacuoles are not present. Strictly aerobic. Oxidase- and catalase- positive. Growth occurs in media containing between 1.5 and 5.2 M NaCl; optimum concentration: 3.5-4.5 M NaCl. Mg2+ requirement: 0.005 M. Temperature range for growth: 30-56°C; optimum: 50°C. Chemoorganotrophic. Many sugars (glucose, galactose, mannose, fructose, ribose, maltose, lactose and sucrose) are utilized with the production of acid. Amino acids are required for growth. Gelatin and starch are not hydrolyzed. Indole is not produced. The polar lipids are C20, C20 derivatives of PG, PGP, PGS and a sulphated mannosyl glucosyl diether glycolipid. Isolated from marine salterns. The mol% G+C of the DNA is 71.2 (Bd). A minor DNA component has not been detected. Type strain: ATCC 29252 (NCIMB 2081; DSM 1137).
